title: Bnot Eilat F.C.
text:
Bnot Eilat () is an Israeli <a href="women%27s%20soccer">women's football</a> club from <a href="Eilat">Eilat</a> competing in the <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">Israeli Second League</a> and the <a href="Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">Israeli Women's Cup</a>.
History.
The club was established in 2010 by footballer <a href="Ann%20Levy">Ann Levy</a> and entered the <a href="Ligat%20Nashim">league's second division</a> in <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Ligat%20Nashim%23Ligat%20Nashim%20Shniya">2012</a>. The club qualified to the promotion group of the league, but finished fourth. The <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Ligat%20Nashim%23Ligat%20Nashim%20Shniya">next season</a> the club missed on promotion once again, as it finished third in the league.
In the <a href="Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">cup</a>, the club is yet to win a game. In its <a href="2012%E2%80%9313%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup%23Gvia%20Ligat%20Nashim%20Shniya">first season</a> the club competed in the Second Division League Cup, and was beaten 0–1 by <a href="F.C.%20Kafr%20Yasif">F.C. Kafr Yasif</a>. The club entered the main competition the <a href="2013%E2%80%9314%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">next season</a>, and was beaten 0–17 by top division’s <a href="Maccabi%20Kishronot%20Hadera%20F.C.">Maccabi Kishronot Hadera</a>, the club's worst defeat ever. In <a href="2014%E2%80%9315%20Israeli%20Women%27s%20Cup">the 2014–15 competition</a> the club met <a href="Maccabi%20Be%27er%20Sheva%20F.C.%20%28women%29">Maccabi Be'er Sheva</a> in the first round, and was beaten 0–6.
